services_deployed.waste_factor: Massive over-provisioning for a single microservice
Running SageMaker notebooks 24/7 with large instances
Running RDS databases 24/7 for development environments

deployment_scenario: The deployment scenario likely involved a developer or team that was following tutorials without fully understanding the use cases. They deployed a massive EKS cluster with 50 nodes for a single microservice, which is an extreme over-provisioning. They also ran CloudFront for internal-only applications, which is unnecessary. Additionally, they used SageMaker notebooks with large instances for trivial workloads and ran RDS databases 24/7 for development environments. These choices indicate a lack of cost awareness and optimization.
key_mistakes: Massive over-provisioning of EKS nodes for a single microservice
Using SageMaker notebooks with large instances for trivial workloads
Running RDS databases 24/7 for development environments
recommendations: Right-size the EKS cluster based on actual workload requirements
Avoid running CloudFront for internal-only applications
Use smaller instances for SageMaker notebooks unless necessary
Use RDS instances only when needed and shut them down when not in use
Optimize storage usage based on actual data needs
